NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSAllergyIntolerance 0..*BaseAllergy Intolerance
Instances of this logical model are not marked to be the target of a Reference
identifier 0..*IdentifierC.21.1 - Identifier
allergyDescription 0..1NarrativeC.21.2 - Allergy description
typeOfPropensity 0..1CodeableConceptC.21.3 - Type of propensity
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

allergyManifestation 0..*BackboneElementC.21.4 - Allergy manifestation
date 0..1dateTimeC.21.4.1 - Date
severity 0..1CodeableConceptC.21.4.2 - Severity
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

description 0..1NarrativeC.21.4.3 - Description
manifestation 1..*CodeableConceptC.21.4.4 - Manifestation
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT


criticality 0..1CodeableConceptC.21.5 - Criticality
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

onsetDate 0..1dateTimeC.21.6 - Onset date
onsetLifePeriod 0..1CodeableConceptC.21.7 - Onset life period
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

endDate 0..1dateTimeC.21.8 - End date
endDateLifePeriod 0..1CodeableConceptC.21.9 - End date life period
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

status 0..1CodeableConceptC.21.10 - Status
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

certainty 0..1CodeableConceptC.21.11 - Certainty
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

agentOrAllergen 1..1CodeableConceptC.21.12 - Agent or Allergen
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT, ATC, (IDMP / EMA SPOR SMS)


Documentation for this format

name: EHDSAllergyIntolerance
title: Allergy Intolerance
description: C.21 - EHDS refined base model for Allergy Intolerance

element.definition: C.21 - EHDS refined base model for Allergy Intolerance
Appointment identifier
Textual description of the allergy or intolerance
This element describes whether this condition refers to an allergy, non-allergy intolerance, or unknown class of intolerance (not known to be allergy or intolerance)

Description of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction including date of manifestation and severity. Example: anaphylactic shock, angioedema (the clinical manifestation also gives information about the severity of the observed reaction). Multiple manifestations could be provided.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R5/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: Date and time of allergy manifestation
Severity of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction.
Description of the event as a whole
Clinical symptoms/signs associated with the Event
Potential risk for future life-threatening adverse reactions when exposed to a substance known to cause an adverse reaction.
Date of onset of allergy, e.g., date of the first observation of the reaction. Partial date could be used. or life period (childhood, adolescence).
Date of onset of allergy, e.g., date of the first observation of the reaction expressed usingor life period (childhood, adolescence, etc.).
Date of resolution of the allergy (e.g. when the clinician deemed there is no longer any need to track the underlying condition)
Date of resolution of the allergy (e.g. when the clinician deemed there is no longer any need to track the underlying condition) exprssed using life period (childhood, … )
Current status of the allergy or intolerance, for example, whether it is active, in remission, resolved, and so on …
Assertion about the certainty associated with a propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance. Diagnostic and/or clinical evidence of condition.
A specific allergen or other agent/substance (drug, food, chemical agent, etc.) to which the patient has an adverse reaction propensity.

binding.description: SNOMED CT, ATC, (IDMP / EMA SPOR SMS)
